intro: Chomelia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered chomelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Chomelia minutiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in forests.
